intro: Senecio cuencanus var. tomentellus, commonly known as the woolly senecio, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Andean regions of Peru and Bolivia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hairs, which help reduce water loss and reflect sunlight. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique appearance.
